pullRequest.body:
Leftmost derivations are often easier to reason about than arbitrary derivations. This
adds leftmost variants of Rewrites, Produces and Derives to the existing definition of context free grammar
and proofs that a string of terminals can be derived iff it can be leftmost derived.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

### PR summary [86f5e922ee](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/18672/commits/86f5e922ee13308486acd831f6acf2d7afc5d2a4)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.Computability.LeftmostDerivation`|500|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ DerivesLeftmost`
`+ DerivesLeftmost.append_left`
`+ DerivesLeftmost.append_right`
`+ DerivesLeftmost.eq_or_head`
`+ DerivesLeftmost.eq_or_tail`
`+ DerivesLeftmost.refl`
`+ DerivesLeftmost.trans`
`+ DerivesLeftmost.trans_produces`
`+ ProducesLeftmost`
`+ ProducesLeftmost.append_left`
`+ ProducesLeftmost.append_right`
`+ ProducesLeftmost.single`
`+ ProducesLeftmost.trans_derivesLeftmost`
`+ RewritesLeftmost`
`+ RewritesLeftmost.append_left`
`+ RewritesLeftmost.append_right`
`+ RewritesLeftmost.exists_parts`
`+ RewritesLeftmost.rewrite_terminal`
`+ RewritesLeftmost.rewritesLeftmost_iff`
`+ RewritesLeftmost.rewritesLeftmost_of_exists_parts`
`+ derivesLeftmost_append`
`+ derivesLeftmost_cons`
`+ derivesLeftmost_iff`
`+ derives_cons`
`+ derives_of_derivesLeftmost`
`+ produces_of_produces_leftmost`
`+ rewritesLeftmost_append`
`+ rewritesLeftmost_cons`
`+ rewrites_append`
`+ rewrites_cons`
`+ rewrites_of_rewritesLeftmost`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>
I don't know what the correct style for vertical lines is; I don't use them at all.
In all theorem names, `rewrites_leftmost` should be written together because `rewritesLeftmost` clearly indicates that `RewritesLeftmost` is the definition it refers to.
probably don't call `symm` as a tactic; rather indicate later `obtain ⟨l₁,_,_,h,_⟩ := h₁.symm`
If possible, use descriptive names instead.

```suggestion
theorem derives_of_derivesLeftmost {u v : List (Symbol T g.NT)} (h : g.DerivesLeftmost u v) :
```

pullRequest.title: feat: add leftmost derivation in context free grammar
